noun.description: A piece of absorbent material wrapped around a baby's bottom and between its legs to absorb and retain urine and feces.
A linen or cotton fabric woven in a repeating pattern of small diamonds.

verb.description: Decorate (a surface) with a repeating geometric or floral pattern.

origin: Middle English: from Old French diapre, from medieval Latin diasprum, from medieval Greek diaspros (adjective), from dia across + aspros white. The term seems originally to have denoted a costly fabric, but after the 15th century it was used as in diaper (sense 2 of the noun); babies' nappies were originally made from pieces of this fabric, hence diaper (sense 1 of the noun) (late 16th century).
